titles.title: Criminal History Background Checks Pilot Extension Act of 2009
Criminal History Background Checks Pilot Extension Act of 2009
Criminal History Background Checks Pilot Extension Act of 2009
Criminal History Background Checks Pilot Extension Act of 2009
A bill to extend the pilot program for volunteer groups to obtain criminal history background checks.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Mr. Johnson (GA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2950.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Johnson (GA) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary: 3/1/2010--Public Law. Criminal History Background Checks Pilot Extension Act of 2009 - Amends the PROTECT Act to extend by 14 months the Child Safety Pilot Program (allowing certain volunteer organizations to obtain national and state criminal history background checks on their volunteers).
